name: "O" Give Me a Bible Quiz | Bible Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Under what did Jacob hide all the strange gods and earrings the people gave him in Genesis 35:4 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
oak tree.

	It says the oak was near Shechem. Shechem was the first capital of Israel back in Biblical times.

Obed.

	The end of the book of Ruth says that "Boaz begat Obed and Obed begat Jesse and Jesse begat David." Obed is also mentioned in Matthew 1, in Christ's genealogy.

questions.text: According to Romans 5:19 (KJV), by one man's what shall "many be made righteous"?
questions.explanation:
obedience.

	Romans 5:19 says, "For as by one man's disobedience many were made sinners, so by the obedience of one shall many be made righteous." Many Christians believe the disobedient man refers to Adam when he ate the forbidden fruit. Likewise, they believe the obedient one refers to Jesus who, according to Philippians 2:8, was "obedient unto death, even death on a cross".

questions.text: What does John 12:3 (KJV) say the house was filled with the smell of?
questions.explanation:
odor of ointment.

	The ointment was spikenard, which was a very expensive ointment. Mary poured the ointment on Jesus' feet which upset Judas Iscariot, who said in John 12:5, "Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?" Jesus told him to leave her alone. He went on in the chapter to say there would always be poor people. He, however, would not be on Earth forever.

questions.text: Jesus says to pluck out your eye when it has done what?
questions.explanation:
offended thee.

	The verse can be found in Matthew 5:29. The next verse says if the "right hand offend thee, cut it off". He is talking about the church being one body and how it's better to lose one member than for the entire church to fall apart.

questions.text: What is the missing word that Jesus said in Revelation 1:8 (KJV)? "I am the Alpha and the__________."
questions.explanation:
Omega.

	Alpha is the first letter of the Greek alphabet and Omega is the last. He goes on to say that He's "the beginning and the end".

questions.text: What does Psalm 5:9 (KJV) say their (David's enemies) throat is?
questions.explanation:
open sepulchre.

	He says "they flatter with their tongue". A sepulchre is a tomb. He is explaining how his enemies are wicked. Like a sepulchre the throat is never satisfied. Also, the throat my spit out corruptness, filthy speech and other bad things, likewise a tomb can emit a foul smell.

questions.text: Jubal was the "father of all such as handle the harp and the what", according to Genesis 4:21?
questions.explanation:
organ.

	Jubal was a descent of Cain. He was the first musician mentioned in the Bible.

questions.text: Fill in the missing word from I Chronicles 19:13 (KJV): "Be of good courage and let us behave _____ valiantly for our people and for all the cities of God: and let the Lord do that which is good in his sight."
questions.explanation:
ourselves.

	To behave valiantly is to behave as if you have worth. In other words, Christians believe, you should behave as if you were created by God.

questions.text: Who was Jesse's sixth born son?
questions.explanation:
Ozem.

	David (who went on to be king) was Jesse's seventh and youngest son. Ozem's name means "that fasts".
